message: A tie between 'The Portable Atheist by Christopher Hitchens' and 'Doubt by Jennifer Michael Hecht' - Both reveal a wonderful and diverse history of religious & theological doubt.
Dennet's _Darwin's Dangerous Idea_ converted me from "this all has to be designed" to "oh wait, no it doesn't".

Also, 'The greatest Show on Earth' by Dawkins was very compelling from an evolution standpoint, but I think listening to Sam Harris on YouTube has actually been the most succinct and convincing arguments on atheism in general.
'God Delusion' by Dawkins gave a good overview of the arguments for me, but I was already an atheist.
